items.title: Sebi promotes broadened investor participation in infrastructure sector for enhanced liquidity
items.description: SEBI is looking to attract a wider range of investors, including mutual funds, pension funds, and retail participants, to the infrastructure sector to boost liquidity in infrastructure securities. Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey highlighted the need for expedited asset monetisation by state governments and cautioned against over-reliance on banks and government funding, advocating for market-based instruments to diversify risk.

items.title: Stocks in news: Adani Enterprises, Adani Power, Vedanta, Texmaco Rail, Oil India
items.description: Markets showed volatility but maintained a positive trend. Adani Group stocks are in focus as Sebi dismissed allegations in the Hindenburg case. Indian Hotels clarified its leasehold rights for The Pierre hotel. Bombay Dyeing appointed Rohit Santhosh as CEO of Bombay Realty, while Oil India anticipates the restart of a Mozambique LNG project by year-end.

items.title: NaBFID needs to make ambitious projects bankable: DFS secretary
items.description: NaBFID, having sanctioned ₹2 lakh crore in projects, is urged to enhance expertise and systems for long-term infrastructure viability, according to M Nagaraju. He suggested NaBFID act as a transaction advisor, mitigating early-stage risks to attract commercial investment. Focus should be on urban infrastructure and water, developing standards and engaging with states to improve project bankability.

items.title: Motilal Oswal settles case with Sebi,  pays Rs 34.85 lakh as settlement charges
items.description: Sebi has settled proceedings with Motilal Oswal Financial Services regarding a case of suspected front-running by the Chaturvedi Group, linked to a large client's trades. The brokerage paid ₹34.85 lakh as settlement charges. The regulator alleged the firm failed to maintain proper order records and attempted to create supporting documents post-execution, leading to a show-cause notice earlier this year.

items.title: Will US Fed rate cut lead to revival of foreign investment in Indian stocks
items.description: Following the US Federal Reserve's rate cut, anticipation surrounds the potential return of foreign capital to Indian equities. However, high valuations in India and attractive opportunities in markets like China may temper inflows. While foreign selling has slowed, a significant turnaround hinges on domestic institutional investor activity and improved earnings momentum to shift FPI sentiment.

items.title: Nifty, Sensex rise for a 3rd day after US Fed rate cut
items.description: Indian stock indices climbed for the third consecutive session on Thursday, buoyed by the US Federal Reserve's expected interest rate cut. The NSE Nifty and BSE Sensex both closed 0.4% higher, while the India Volatility Index hit a record low. Foreign and domestic portfolio investors were net buyers, contributing to the positive market sentiment.

items.title: Stock Radar: Defense major HAL gains momentum; upside seen till Rs 5,130, Shivangi Sarda recommends
items.description: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited stock broke out after consolidating for two months. Experts suggest short-term traders consider buying. The stock previously hit a high in May. It faced resistance around Rs 4,600. Support was found near Rs 4,300. The stock rallied over ten percent in a week. Analysts recommend a target of Rs 5,130 in the coming weeks.

items.title: Step up infrastructure credit flow, India requires $4.5 trillion growth capital: PFRDA
items.description: India requires a substantial $4.5 trillion infrastructure investment by 2030 to maintain its desired growth. Sivasubramanian Ramann highlighted the shift in financing from banks to pension and insurance funds, better suited for long-term projects. Regulatory reforms and wider use of credit enhancement schemes are expected to boost credit flow and bond issuance for infrastructure companies.

items.title: NCLT approves Gayatri Projects' settlement plan from promoters
items.description: The Hyderabad NCLT has approved a ₹2,400 crore OTS plan by Gayatri Projects' promoters, resolving ₹8,100 crore in dues to lenders led by Canara Bank. With 97% lender approval, the promoters have 90 days to pay ₹750 crore, cover bank guarantee invocations, and allocate ₹450 crore from arbitration claims.

items.title: Godfrey Phillips India shares in focus following arrest of director Samir Modi
items.description: Godfrey Phillips India's shares are under scrutiny after director Samir Modi's arrest in Delhi on rape charges, following a complaint filed by a former employee alleging repeated sexual assault since 2019. Modi's legal team denies the allegations, claiming extortion.

items.title: Vedanta shares in focus after being named preferred bidder for manganese block in Andhra Pradesh
items.description: Vedanta share price: Vedanta has been declared the ‘Preferred Bidder’ for the Punnam Manganese Block in Andhra Pradesh after qualifying in the government’s auction process. The 152-hectare block is at the G4 exploration stage, and the license grant will be subject to regulatory approvals and conditions.

items.title: Hindenburg case ends: 5 Adani Group stocks with potential to rally up to 58%
items.description: The Sebi closure of investigations into the Hindenburg allegations has come as a major relief to the Adani Group. With the regulatory cloud lifted, brokerages have turned their focus back to fundamentals and growth potential. Here are five Adani stocks that analysts believe could rally significantly from current levels.

items.title: Adani Group stocks in focus as Sebi clears Gautam Adani, Rajesh Adani of Hindenburg allegations
items.description: Adani Group share price: Sebi has given a clean chit to Gautam Adani, Rajesh Adani, and several Adani Group firms in the Hindenburg case, saying its probe found no fraud, fund misuse, or rule violations. The regulator said the transactions in question were regular loans and not related-party deals.

items.title: Dividend alert: BEML, 56 other stocks to go ex-dividend on Monday. Do you own any?
items.description: Investors seeking BEML Ltd's dividend must buy shares today. September 22 is the record date. Many listed firms also offer dividends with the same record date. A list of companies trading ex-dividend today includes AB Infrabuild, Accel Ltd, Bajaj Holdings, and many more. Investors should purchase shares before market close to receive dividends. This information is sourced from StockEdge data.

items.title: Adani Power 1:5 stock split: Last day to buy shares for first-ever split eligibility
items.description: Investors have one last chance to buy Adani Power shares to qualify for the stock split. The record date is September 22, 2025. Each share of face value Rs 10 will split into five shares of face value Rs 2. Shareholders approved the split on September 4, 2025. The company aims to increase outstanding shares and improve liquidity.

items.title: Smallcap stock with 1,100% 5-year returns to go ex-bonus for 2:1 bonus issue. Last day to buy
items.description: Sandur Manganese & Iron Ores announces a 2:1 bonus issue. Investors aiming for bonus shares must buy shares today. September 22, 2025, is the record date. The company's stock has shown significant growth in the past. Shareholders will receive two shares for each share held. This bonus issue increases the total number of outstanding shares.

items.title: Interns are being offered $14,000 a month by high-speed trading firms in India
items.description: Despite regulatory scrutiny in India's equity derivatives market, high-speed trading firms are significantly increasing entry-level pay. Companies like IMC Trading and Quadeye are offering lucrative packages to interns and new hires, driven by the potential for substantial profits.

items.title: Banco Products among 5 stocks witness 5-year swing high breakout
items.description: In the NSE list of companies with a market cap over Rs 10,000 crore, five stocks witnessed a 5-year swing high at the close on September 18, suggesting bullishness in counters, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data.A 5-year swing high represents the highest price a stock has reached within a five-year timeframe. This level acts as a significant resistance point where the price has historically struggled to go beyond. This occurrence may be seen as bullish, indicating the potential for further upward movement in the stock. However, it's worth noting that this is different from a 5-year breakout, which occurs when a stock's price surpasses a key resistance level that has held for five years or longer.

items.title: Biocon, ITC among 8 Stocks flashing bullish RSI signals
items.description: Eight stocks in the Nifty200 pack were highlighted in the RSI Trending Up scan on September 18, based on data from stockedge.com. It is an uptrend signal if the RSI value has crossed above 50 from below. "RSI trending up" means that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are increasing, suggesting strengthening momentum in the stock price. This can indicate potential upward movement and may be used by traders to identify buying opportunities.

items.title: Positive Breakout: These 6 stocks close cross above their 200 DMAs
items.description: The closing prices of six stocks from the Nifty500 pack crossed above their 200 DMAs (Daily Moving Averages) on September 18, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. The 200-day daily moving average (DMA) is used as a key indicator by traders for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily time frame, it is generally considered to be an overall uptrend. Take a look:

items.title: Wall Street indexes notch record-high closes as Intel soars on Nvidia stake
items.description: Wall Street saw record highs after the US Federal Reserve reduced interest rates. Chipmaker Intel experienced a significant surge following Nvidia's investment. The small-cap Russell 2000 index also reached a new high. The Fed indicated potential further rate cuts due to a softening job market. CrowdStrike shares rose after brokerage upgrades.

items.title: Motilal Oswal bullish on HAL: breakout, strong volumes support uptrend
items.description: “Hindustan Aeronautics (HAL) stock has remained in strong focus on the back of a sustained uptrend in both its price action and derivatives activity, reinforcing bullish strength from the chart as well as data. Traders can buy for a target of Rs 5130 in the next 2-3 weeks,” Shivangi Sarda, Analyst, Derivatives and Technical Research, Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd, said.

items.title: Asian stocks rise as global gauge hits new peak
items.description: Asian stock markets are performing well. US equity benchmarks reached new highs. This was supported by the Federal Reserve's interest rate cut. Stocks in Japan and Australia increased. South Korea remained stable. The S&P 500 and other indexes achieved record highs together. The yen remained steady after Japan's inflation slowed. The Bank of Japan's rate decision is expected.

items.title: Sebi gives clean chit to Adani on Hindenburg allegations
items.description: Sebi has exonerated Gautam Adani and other Adani group companies regarding Hindenburg Research's allegations of stock manipulation. The investigation, spanning from FY13 to FY21, found no evidence of fraudulent transactions or siphoning of funds. Sebi concluded that the transactions in question did not qualify as related-party transactions, thus not violating listing agreements.

items.title: Will Saatvik Green Energy IPO spark long-term value for investors?
items.description: Saatvik Green Energy, a solar module manufacturer, is planning an IPO. The company aims to raise ₹700 crore through fresh equity. It will use the funds to expand capacity and repay debt. An additional ₹200 crore will be raised through an offer for sale. The IPO will reduce promoter stake to 76.02%. Saatvik's financials show strong revenue and profit growth.
